alert.note: Alert for Chester; Hardin; McNairy (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 9:36PM CDT until April 01 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN MCNAIRY...NORTHWESTERN HARDIN AND EAST CENTRAL CHESTER COUNTIES... At 936 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 7 miles northeast of Selmer, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Tornado, quarter size hail, and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Savannah, Selmer, Adamsville, Morris Chapel, Crump, Bethel Springs, Eastview, Finger, Stantonville, Milledgeville, Enville, Forty Forks, Good Hope, Right, Phillips, Old Lawton, Hinkle, Roby, Cabo and Walkertown. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
